title: Job 10:1
text: MY soul is weary of my life; I will leave my complaint upon myself; I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.

title: Job 10:2
text: I will say unto God, Do not condemn me; shew me wherefore thou contendest with me.

title: Job 10:3
text: Is it good unto thee that thou shouldest oppress, that thou shouldest despise the work of thine hands, and shine upon the counsel of the wicked?

title: Job 10:4
text: Hast thou eyes of flesh?  or seest thou as man seeth?

title: Job 10:5
text: Are thy days as the days of man?  are thy years as man's days,

title: Job 10:6
text: That thou enquirest after mine iniquity, and searchest after my sin?

title: Job 10:7
text: Thou knowest that I am not wicked; and there is none that can deliver out of thine hand.

title: Job 10:8
text: Thine hands have made me and fashioned me together round about; yet thou dost destroy me.

title: Job 10:9
text: Remember, I beseech thee, that thou hast made me as the clay; and wilt thou bring me into dust again?

title: Job 10:10
text: Hast thou not poured me out as milk, and curdled me like cheese?

title: Job 10:11
text: Thou hast clothed me with skin and flesh, and hast fenced me with bones and sinews.

title: Job 10:12
text: Thou hast granted me life and favour, and thy visitation hath preserved my spirit.

title: Job 10:13
text: And these things hast thou hid in thine heart: I know that this is with thee.

title: Job 10:14
text: If I sin, then thou markest me, and thou wilt not acquit me from mine iniquity.

title: Job 10:15
text: If I be wicked, woe unto me; and if I be righteous, yet will I not lift up my head.  I am full of confusion; therefore see thou mine affliction;

title: Job 10:16
text: For it increaseth.  Thou huntest me as a fierce lion: and again thou shewest thyself marvellous upon me.

title: Job 10:17
text: Thou renewest thy witnesses against me, and increasest thine indignation upon me; changes and war are against me.

title: Job 10:18
text: Wherefore then hast thou brought me forth out of the womb?  Oh that I had given up the ghost, and no eye had seen me!

title: Job 10:19
text: I should have been as though I had not been; I should have been carried from the womb to the grave.

title: Job 10:20
text: Are not my days few?  cease then, and let me alone, that I may take comfort a little,

title: Job 10:21
text: Before I go whence I shall not return, even to the land of darkness and the shadow of death;

title: Job 10:22
text: A land of darkness, as darkness itself; and of the shadow of death, without any order, and where the light is as darkness.
